meanings.definition: A condition in which one eye has reduced vision due to abnormal development during childhood.
meanings.sent1: Amblyopia can cause one eye to have weaker vision than the other.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed the child with amblyopia after noticing the vision difference in their eyes.
meanings.sent3: The pirate joked that his amblyopia was from staring at the sun too long with a telescope.
meanings.sent4: Her amblyopia was like a shadow, always lurking in the corner of her vision.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a puppet show to explain amblyopia to the students, making it a fun learning experience.

meanings.definition: The medical term for lazy eye.
meanings.sent1: The optometrist explained that amblyopia is another name for lazy eye.
meanings.sent2: She wore an eye patch to help treat her amblyopia and strengthen her weaker eye.
meanings.sent3: The lazy cat humorously claimed to have amblyopia as an excuse for napping all day.
meanings.sent4: His amblyopia was a constant reminder to take breaks and rest his eyes during work.
meanings.sent5: The artist depicted amblyopia in a painting, showing the struggle of blurred vision in one eye.
